questions.question: How can you select multiple adjacent worksheets?
options: Click the first tab, hold Shift, and click the last tab
Hold Ctrl and click each tab
questions.answer: Click the first tab, hold Shift, and click the last tab

questions.question: How can you select multiple non-adjacent worksheets?
options: Hold Ctrl and click each worksheet tab
Hold Shift and click the tabs
questions.answer: Hold Ctrl and click each worksheet tab

questions.question: What happens when you select multiple worksheets and enter data?
options: Data is entered into all selected worksheets simultaneously
Data is entered only into the active worksheet
questions.answer: Data is entered into all selected worksheets simultaneously

Right-click tab, select 'Rename', type 'Sales2025', press Enter

Drag and drop tab to another workbook
questions.answer: Right-click tab, select 'Move or Copy', choose destination workbook

questions.question: How do you delete multiple worksheets at once?

Delete one worksheet at a time

questions.question: Which of the following is true about hiding worksheets?
options: Hidden worksheets are not visible but still exist in the workbook
questions.answer: Hidden worksheets are not visible but still exist in the workbook

questions.question: How can you unhide multiple worksheets at once?
options: Right-click any tab, select 'Unhide', and select worksheets one by one
Select all worksheets and click unhide

options: You can rename, move, copy, hide, unhide, and color them

options: Right-click the navigation arrows and select the sheet

questions.question: Which of the following is a reason to hide a worksheet?

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT affected when you hide a worksheet?
options: Ability to reference data in formulas

questions.question: How do you insert a single row in an Excel worksheet?
options: Right-click the whole row *above* which you want to insert the new row, and then select Insert Rows.
Right-click the whole row *below* which you want to insert the new row, and then select Insert Rows.
Select a cell and press Ctrl + R.
Select a cell and go to Insert > Insert Cell.
questions.answer: Right-click the whole row *above* which you want to insert the new row, and then select Insert Rows.

questions.question: How do you insert multiple rows in Excel?
options: Select the same number of rows *above* which you want to add new ones, right-click the selection, and then select Insert Rows.
Select a single row and click Insert Rows multiple times.
Select a range of cells and press Shift + Insert.
Go to Insert tab and choose 'Insert multiple rows'.
questions.answer: Select the same number of rows *above* which you want to add new ones, right-click the selection, and then select Insert Rows.

questions.question: How do you insert a single column in an Excel worksheet?
options: Right-click the whole column to the *right* of where you want to add the new column, and then select Insert Columns.
Right-click the whole column to the *left* of where you want to add the new column, and then select Insert Columns.
Select a cell and press Ctrl + C.
Select a cell and go to Insert > Insert Cell.
questions.answer: Right-click the whole column to the *right* of where you want to add the new column, and then select Insert Columns.

questions.question: How do you insert multiple columns in Excel?
options: Select the same number of columns to the *right* of where you want to add new ones, right-click the selection, and then select Insert Columns.
Select a single column and click Insert Columns multiple times.
Select a range of cells and press Shift + C.
Go to Insert tab and choose 'Insert multiple columns'.
questions.answer: Select the same number of columns to the *right* of where you want to add new ones, right-click the selection, and then select Insert Columns.

questions.question: Where can you find the 'Insert Sheet Rows' and 'Insert Sheet Columns' options on the Ribbon?
How do you delete a row in Excel?
options: Select the row, right-click, and then select Delete Rows.
Select the row and press the Delete key.
Go to Home tab > Delete > Delete Cells.
Drag the row out of the worksheet.
questions.answer: Select the row, right-click, and then select Delete Rows.

questions.question: How do you delete a column in Excel?
options: Select the column, right-click, and then select Delete Columns.
Select the column and press the Delete key.
Go to Home tab > Delete > Delete Cells.
Drag the column out of the worksheet.
questions.answer: Select the column, right-click, and then select Delete Columns.

questions.question: Where can you find the 'Delete Sheet Rows' and 'Delete Sheet Columns' options on the Ribbon?
What happens to other rows or columns when you delete rows or columns in Excel?
options: Other rows or columns automatically shift up or to the left.
Other rows or columns automatically shift down or to the right.
Other rows or columns remain unchanged.
questions.answer: Other rows or columns automatically shift up or to the left.

questions.question: Which keyboard shortcut can be used to undo a deletion in Excel?
How do you resize a column manually in Excel?
options: Drag the boundary between two column headings.
Right-click a cell and select 'Resize Column'.
Go to Home tab > Format > Row Height.
questions.answer: Drag the boundary between two column headings.

questions.question: How do you resize a row manually in Excel?
options: Drag the boundary between two row headings.
Right-click a cell and select 'Resize Row'.
Go to Home tab > Format > Column Width.
questions.answer: Drag the boundary between two row headings.

questions.question: Which option automatically adjusts the column width to fit the longest entry in a cell?

How do you hide a row in Excel?
options: Right-click the row heading and select 'Hide'.
Select the row and press Ctrl + H.
Go to Home tab > Delete > Hide Row.
Drag the row boundary to zero.
questions.answer: Right-click the row heading and select 'Hide'.

questions.question: How do you hide a column in Excel?
options: Right-click the column heading and select 'Hide'.
Select the column and press Ctrl + H.
Go to Home tab > Delete > Hide Column.
Drag the column boundary to zero.
questions.answer: Right-click the column heading and select 'Hide'.

questions.question: How do you unhide a hidden row in Excel?
options: Select the rows above and below the hidden row, right-click, and select 'Unhide'.
Right-click anywhere in the sheet and select 'Unhide Row'.
Go to Home tab > Format > Hide & Unhide > Unhide Rows.

questions.question: How do you unhide a hidden column in Excel?
options: Select the columns to the left and right of the hidden column, right-click, and select 'Unhide'.
Right-click anywhere in the sheet and select 'Unhide Column'.
Go to Home tab > Format > Hide & Unhide > Unhide Columns.

questions.question: Which of the following is true when you insert a row or column that has formatting applied?
options: The formatting will be transferred to the new row or column.
The new row or column will have no formatting.
The existing formatting will be deleted.
Excel will ask you to choose a new format.
questions.answer: The formatting will be transferred to the new row or column.

options: New row appears above the selected row.
New row appears below the selected row.
New row replaces the selected row.
New row appears to the right of the selected row.
questions.answer: New row appears above the selected row.

questions.question: Which of the following describes the process of inserting a column in Excel?
options: New column appears to the left of the selected column.
New column appears to the right of the selected column.
New column replaces the selected column.
New column appears below the selected column.
questions.answer: New column appears to the left of the selected column.

options: The row number is skipped in the sequence.
The row number becomes a letter.
questions.answer: The row number is skipped in the sequence.

questions.question: When a column is hidden, what happens to its column letter?
options: The column letter is skipped in the sequence.
The column letter becomes a number.
questions.answer: The column letter is skipped in the sequence.

Click each cell while holding Ctrl
